fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41287].
  {panel}

During work with Jira we have small problem with Jira issue navigator.
Example:
User need to work with results of JQL filter that returns ~400 issues.
It is 20 pages with issues with 20 issues per page.
Currently system displays links only to 5 pages simultaneously. This parameter is global and can't be changed.
There is also no way to go to page number 8 (for example) when you are on very first page.
It will be very helpful if user will be able to do following things:
1) Configure quantity of displayed pages (at least for himself, maybe for project)
2) "Jump" to specified page by entering it number
3) Change the "issues number per page"  parameter value (for example 20, 50, 100 issues per page would be really nice)
fields.summary: Ability to configure quantity of shown pages in Jira issue navigator and to go to specified page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41286].
  {panel}

The Windows installers and screenshot applet need up to date certificates. We use 2-year certificates. For supportability purposes we should start using 3 or 4 year certificates. To ensure we're always up to date we should be pro-actively updating these on a semi regular basis, although because the signatures are often stamped with a timestamp server even when the certificates expire they should still appear as trusted.

The CSR's can take a while to come through once we put in requests to IT and our certificate provider, so this should be done in late 2015  so that we:
* have time to request tickets from IT and incorporate them
* our product continues to be trusted, and in the case of the applet work, for some period after release.

The current round of certificates expire in late 2016. See JRA-35664.

Once you've done this task, create another one with similar parameters to be started in a year and finished in 18 months. Hooray!
fields.summary: New certificates for Windows installer and applets
Log Work dialog is slow to display

fields.description:
h2. Synopsis
When connecting Fisheye to JIRA if you navigate to the project and click on source, all statistic images are shown as broken. All diagnostics come back fine and the applinks are set up using Oath. We tested this same application link on JIRA 6.2 and the images show up correctly

h2. Steps to Reproduce
- Connect Fisheye to JIRA using Applinks
- Make a push from Fisheye to JIRA
- Navigate to Project > Source  

h2. Intended Results
- Statistics and Images should show up

h2. Actual Results
- All images are broken
fields.summary: Fisheye Statistcs Broken Within JIRA Source Tab on Project

fields.description:
# Create a custom field with a choice type. I tested with the Checkboxes and the Select List (single choice) type fields. I tested this issue with a Text Field type (multi line), and it didn't work.
# Set the field up to use only certain Issue Types. Just make sure that the type you choose also has the same type included in your CSV file. My field type utilized the Bug Issue Type. I tested with one, two, and three different types chosen at once. I reproduced each time.
# Have a CSV file with all the necessary fields to achieve an import cleanly. Just make sure there's a column for the custom field you just created.
# Map the fields.
# Instead of choosing the "Begin Import" button, you can choose "Validate".
# When you do, you should receive an error like this one:
{code}
Cannot add custom field value: null
The value [ {null=CustomValue} ] can't be added to the Custom Field [ CustomField ]. The value [ {null=CustomValue} ] can't be found or is in the incorrect format
{code}

Workaround:
Instead of choosing an Issue Type for the field configuration scheme when you configure the field, choose "Any issue type".
fields.summary: Import Issues from CSV only works for choice fields that are configured for global issue types

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41278].
  {panel}

Currently our /rest/api/2/password/policy/createUser and /rest/api/2/password/policy/updateUser sections don't have any example on how to actually use the call.

Please add what is expected from this call in the Expand section of [this page|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#d2e3349].

*update from support*

I've managed to identify what these calls do, they still need official docs, but here is the information:

h4. updateUser json

{
"username": "test",
"newPassword": "a",
"oldPassword": "c"
}
Replace username with the username you're updating, newpassword with your new password and old password with whatever your password was. It will then check it against your password policy and let you know if the password is acceptable.

h4. createUser json

{
"username": "test",
"password": "a",
}
Change username to whatever the new user's name will be, and set password to whatever you want to check.

*This functionality does not work in JIRA Cloud, it only works on JIRA Server*
fields.summary: Update /rest/api/2/password/policy/createUser and /rest/api/2/password/policy/updateUser REST documentation
Import from CSV not functioning

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41274].
  {panel}

Using the zephyr test management tool I have exported an extract of my saved execution filter

After I have exported the filter some of the defect ID's are now shown twice in the excel sheet as opposed to once in the Issue Navigator view

I beleive the duplication could be that I cloned the tests with the defects to another version.

I still wouldn't expect to see the duplication of ID's in any case
fields.summary: Export Of Execution filter shows a duplication of linked Defect ID's

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
h5. Set up LDAP server :
- Create User object with objectclass posixAccount
-- Add attribute _gidNumber_ with value '10000' for example
- Create Group object with objectclass posixGroup
-- Add _gidNumber_ attribute with value '10000'

h5. Add directory in JIRA
- Create new LDAP user directory in JIRA
- Choose the type 'OpenLDAP(Read Only Posix Schema)'
(i) Note that the 'Use the User Membership Attribute' is disabled and set to a non-existent attribute for this user object (eg. memberOf)

- Synchronize with LDAP server

h3. Actual Results
- JIRA will synchronize users/groups and determine group membership based on the user objects _gidNumber_ attribute.

h3. Expected Results
- JIRA will synchronize users/groups and determine group memberships based on the users objects, *only* if the option within JIRA to 'Use the User Membership Attribute' is enabled and set to _gidNumber_ attribute.

h3. Workaround
(i) This may not apply to every environment due to the differences in objectClass and attributes available on your LDAP environemnt.
- Switch directory type from "OpenLDAP(Read Only Posix Schema)" to "OpenLDAP" 
- Update user and group schema mappings in JIRA's LDAP connector to match your environment
-- Workaround tested by changing group schema settings to filter by a posixGroup objectclass.
fields.summary: JIRA synchronizes groups based on gidNumber attribute when using OpenLDAP(Read Only Posix Schema)

fields.description:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41268].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Go to General Configuration
 # Change Indexing Language to _German_
 # Change Default Language to _Deutsch (Deutschland)_
 # Change Default user time zone to _Europe_ and Timezone to _(GMT+01:00) Berlin_
 # Change any date picker field (e. g Due Date) to any date in March (e.g 4/Mrz/15 10:25 PM)

*Expected Result:*
 - JIRA should be able to recognize "Mrz" abbreviation for March

*Actual Result:*
 - Error thrown as below:

{noformat}
duedate: Sie haben kein gültiges Datum eingegeben. Geben Sie das Datum im Format 'd/MMM/yy' ein (z. B. '16/Dez/14').

{noformat}
{noformat}
duedate: You did not enter a valid date. Please type the date in the format 'd / MMM / yy' (for. & Nbsp; B '16 / Dec / 14 '.).

{noformat}
*Workaround:*
 - Change the date format from _20/Mrz/15_ to _20.03.15_ with the below setting in _Advanced Settings_:
{noformat}
jira.date.picker.javascript.format=%d.%m.%y
jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format=%d.%m.%y %H:%M
jira.date.time.picker.java.format=d.MM.yy H:mm
jira.date.picker.java.format=d.MM.yy

{noformat}
fields.summary: JIRA doesn't recognize "Mrz" abbreviation for March in German
please delete
please delete

fields.description:
h3. Actual Results:

JIRA allows usernames with uppercase characters, which are not respected when importing an existing username in the CSV. Since the import process is changing the usernames to lowercase, new users are being created instead of use the existing one.

h3. Expected Results:

As described in the [Importing Data from CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Importing+Data+from+CSV] doc, the CSV import will convert the usernames to lowercase during the process. 

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create an user in JIRA using capital letters. Ex: "Test User";
# Import a CSV file with the "Test User" as reporter;
# JIRA will create the "test user" user.

h3. Workaround:

Rename the existing user in JIRA to something without uppercase letters and also different from the actual user (JIRA considers "test user" and "Test User" the same and will not perform the change).
fields.summary: CSV Import creates new user with the actual user has uppercase letters
Ability to mark field as required for specific screen(s)
Webhooks do not respect comment visibility
Android redirect from atlassian Id broken

fields.description:
If in stash I create several pull requests that reference a ticket, JIRA correctly associates the PR with the ticket. But if I later then remove a commit from a PR (say by merging something else that a PR was built on), JIRA still associates the ticket with the PR.

Because the PR no longer pertains to the ticket, JIRA should remove the association. This could be by rescanning everything, or allowing some method of manually editing the associations.
fields.summary: JIRA associates tickets with stash multiple pull requests that are no longer related

fields.description:
Step to reproduce the data:
# install JIRA
# create new projects and issues
# Open up the Developer Tools in Google Chrome
# browse to one of the issue directly using {{$JIRA_URL/browse/Issue_Key}}
# in the Developer Tool's network tab, there is a request to {{$JIRA_URL/rest/api/2/filter/favourite?}}. Refer screenshot :
!NoFavFilter2.png|thumbnail!
# create multiple filters in the instance
# access the same issue and it is still load with the same speed


Problem:
# When accessing issue, background request to the Favourite Filter add additional request to the instance and utilizing more resource
# creating filters increasing the Timing for {{$JIRA_URL/rest/api/2/filter/favourite?}}
** No Favourite Filter:
!NoFavFilter2.png|thumbnail!
** With 5 Filters:
!5FavFilter1.png|thumbnail!
** With 10 Filters:
!10FavFilter.png|thumbnail!


(i) Issue Loading is fast and it is not a problem

h5. Resolution 
This issue is obsolete at least for JIRA 7.0+. There is no more {{/rest/api/2/filter/favourite}} call.
fields.summary: Accessing single issue sending additional request to Favourite Filter

fields.description:
h4.Problem statement: 
During a JQL filter, projects with no permission gives a false error of non existent instead.

h4. Steps to Reproduce: 
1. As an admin, create several new projects (TIA,TIB,TIC,TID,TIE). 
2. As an admin, specify ONLY user A with granted permission for viewing project TIE.
3. As an admin, perform a JQL filter including the 5 projects. (non existent project TIE false error)

h4. Current/Actual behavior: 
False Error
"A value with ID 'E' does not exist for the field project".
!Screen Shot 2014-12-15 at 9.23.47 PM.png!

Add TIE in filter.

!Screen Shot 2014-12-15 at 9.23.14 PM.png!

h4. Expected Behavior: 
Instead of Error Text - *A value with ID 'TIE' does not exist for the field 'project'*
Replace with
"User does not have permission for value with ID 'TIE'  in the field project" 
OR 
*"Project with ID 'TIE' does not exist"*
while
ALWAYS showing the rest of the filter Results.

h4. Additional Info:
fields.summary: JQL filter False Error: Project doesn't exist should be no permission

fields.description:
I need to search for issues that are linked to a remote JIRA. This works fine for all issues types, except the standard issue type "New Feature". The sample search request below includes "New Features" that definitely have links to the remote JIRA:

project = "XXX" AND issuetype in (standardIssueTypes()) AND issue not in (hasRemoteLinks()) ORDER BY createdDate DESC
fields.summary: Advanced Search: hasRemoteLink() search does not work for issue Type "New Feature"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41250].
  {panel}

Current page to manage project categories doesn't allow you to associate projects to a category.

In other words, it means that if you want to add 10 projects to a specific category, you have to visit all 10 projects and associate each one of them to the category.

After a design discussion with [~dhudson], we considered it would be important to add a project picker to both create and edit project category, allowing a quick administration of the associated categories.

This board picker should offer an experience similar to the fields in the "Create Issue" dialog, where you start typing, select an option and move to the next selection (check attached .gif).
fields.summary: Add project picker to create/edit project category

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41247].
  {panel}

*In JIRA 5.x*
* When you disable the inline edit configuration (Administration > System > General Configuration), it will *still show* the pencil icon/inline edit icon even after adding a label.

*In JIRA 6.x*
* When you disable the inline edit configuration (Administration > System > General Configuration), it will *not show* the pencil icon/inline edit icon when there are existing value in the label field.

It is confusing for customer when they upgrade from JIRA 5.x to JIRA 6.x and they do not know where to edit the label field coming from the previous version of JIRA. The intended behaviour could be improve and align with the previous version of JIRA.


*Workaround*
# Go to More > Labels
# Press shortcut key *i* on the keyboard
fields.summary: inconsistency for inline edit on system field - label

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41246].
  {panel}

The basic idea is this:  The dashboard would work exactly as it does today but it would allow you to define search text for that dashboard.  The search text would be added to ALL of the searches used for that dashboard.  

For example, I could add the search text "AND SomeField=SomeValue".  This text would be added to the search text for each widget.  So if the first widget used the search text "project=aa and Field1=bb" then the modified search text would be "project=aa and Field1=bb AND SomeField=SomeValue"

Here is my use case:

I have about 6 dashboards that are all identical to each other except for one thing:  Each dashboard has a unique value for one attribute in the searches that are used for that dashboard.  

To make this happen I start by creating a set of searches which are used by my dashboard widgets.  Then I need to copy all of those searches and modify this one attribute in all of them.  Then I copy the dashboard and edit all of the gadgets to use the new searches.  It is a lot of work.  But worse, if I need to modify any of my searches then I need to modify all 6 copies.
fields.summary: Add search filter to the Dashboard
Give the possibilitie of add the Single Level Group By Report in a dashboard

RK

fields.description:
If you run JIRA on Oracle database it's not possible to set Maximum Authentication Attempts Allowed to Unlimited. 

You will be able to set in the UI, but then it will go back to 3 (the value taken from jpm.xml).

This is because Oracle stores empty string as nulls and a null here causes JIRA to use the default value.

Setting this value to unlimited on any other database (like PostgreSQL) stores an empty string there (and then JIRA will pick up an empty string and translate it to Unlimited correctly).

*Suggested workaround*
Set Maximum Authentication Attempts Allowed to a really high number.
fields.summary: Unable to set Maximum Authentication Attempts Allowed to Unlimited on Oracle DB
Link to Confluence space in Jira overview panel
Add sub-task tree to Issue navigation

fields.description:
I am using the two-dimensional filter to display component vs. priority for a single project (ABC).

To clarify: the filter that is being used to configure the two-dimensional filter is using "project = ABC" and does not have references to any other project(s).

When I click into the numbers on the grid to see the issue navigator view, I notice a problem in the JQL query that is being invoked.

The "project = " clause used ends up being "project = ABC and project = DEF". The only causal link that I can discern is that some of the issues that were meant to be results in the filter, were moved from project DEF to project ABC. If this is the case, it does not make a whole lot of sense as I am only concerned with the issues as they exist in project ABC.
fields.summary: Two-dimensional filter JQL links affected by moved issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41230].
  {panel}

I'd like sub-task issue keys to inherit the issue key of their parent issues.

E.g. so if a Story has issue key FOO-22, when its sub-tasks are created they are given issue keys along the lines of FOO-22-1, FOO-22-2, FOO-22-3, etc.

Benefit: big improvement in clarity on Agile boards.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Allow subtasks issue keys to inherit the parent issue's key.
Newly Created Subtask from a Parent Issue Should be Shown after its' Creation
Wrong or incomplete documentation about pre-population of field when 'Creating Another' issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41227].
  {panel}

Currently, JIRA knows an issue is unresolved when the resolution field is not set. It determines, for example, if a link to the issue should have a strikethrough or not.

Also, [the documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+Resolution+Field+Values] states that a user shouldn't create an 'Unresolved' resolutions, because JIRA will not handle the issue as 'Unresolved' when using this resolution.

This approach has a very problematic characteristic: the resolution field is mandatory, but it not being set has a meaning! It is unresolved.

This brings a few problems:
* There is no flexibility. The users need to either use a post function and trigger a transition or change in the database in case they want to change a resolved issue to 'unresolved'
* We cannot add the 'resolution' field to the 'Edit' Screen for an issue type in a project. If that is done, the user must always set the resolution when editing the issue, even if they wanted to change a completely different field

My suggestion is to add a 'Unresolved' resolution, rather than understanding it as unresolved when this field is not set. It would have the following characteristics:
* This resolution cannot be deleted or modified
* This is a _special_ resolution. When an issue has this resolution, JIRA considers it as unresolved (no strikethrough, etc.)
* You need permission to set as unresolved (otherwise, only the other options will appear)
* If the issue is set as unresolved, it can remain that way, no need to change it when editing an issue.

I think this resolves a question:
How can a required field give a meaning to an unset value?
fields.summary: Create embedded 'Unresolved' resolution

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41226].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
In the notification scheme, no one is set to receive Issue Updated, but users are set to receive Issue Commented. When a comment is added via email, nobody gets notification. When a comment is added via UI, they get notification for Issue Commented.

After some testing I found that commenting via email will trigger Issue Updated, that is the reason users don't receive notification even though they are supposed to receive for Issue Commented. By right commenting via email and UI should behave the same and trigger Issue Commented and users should get notification.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Install JIRA
# Configure Incoming Mail Handler (Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue) and Outgoing Mail
# Remove everyone from *Issue Updated* event but make sure they receive notifications from *Issue Commented* event
# Have a user add a comment to a particular issue via email

h4. Expected Results
# Comment added successfully
# Designated users receive notification
# Notification sent with *Issue Commented* event

h4. Actual Results
# Comment added successfully
# No notification received by users who supposed to receive *Issue Commented* event

h4. Notes
* When the users are configured to receive notification from *Issue Updated* event, then commenting via email will send notifications to the designated users
* Affecting with JIRA 6.3.10 and 6.3.12
* With 6.2.7, notification will be of *Issue Commented* event (intended behavior)
fields.summary: Comments From Email Trigger Notifications for "Issue Updated" Instead of "Issue Commented" Event
Update the JIRA Timesheet Plugin to version 2.8.2.5 in Cloud

fields.description:

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

#* Assigning the due date here is not necessary to trigger the bug, but shows that the calendar control is not broken on all pages.
# View the issue page and click {{More->Watchers}} to view the watchers page for this issue.
# Click {{Create}} from this watchers page.
# Attempt to add a Due Date value.

The calendar popup does not appear and the browser console shows the error "TypeError: Calendar._TT is undefined".
fields.summary: Due Date calendar popup fails when creating issue from Watchers page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41218].
  {panel}

The What's new welcome message in recent versions are not showing the JIRA version. JIRA 6.2 had it, but JIRA 6.3.11 doesn't have it.

It would be nice to bring back the version number, since it helps JIRA Administrators to communicate about the latest JIRA version and also helps users be aware of the latest version.

h3.JIRA 6.3.11 - What's new dialog
!JIRA_Whats_New.png!

h3.Workaround
* JIRA Version is always listed at the page footer.
* Administrators need to use the *Introduction* field from JIRA _General Configuration_ to provide the JIRA version.
fields.summary: Please bring back the JIRA version on what's new

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41216].
  {panel}

I have replicated this on JIRA 6.3.12
h4. Steps to Replicate
# Create a user (e.g. {{jsmith}}).
# Change its username (e.g. to {{john.smith}})
# Go to any issue and select {{john.smith}} as either the assignee or the reporter.
# Click on the History tab.
# The change will display the username {{jsmith}} instead of {{john.smith}}:
!userkey.png!

*Expected Result*
Since the user key is only used internally by the application, we should not expose this information to end-users. The current username should be displayed instead ({{john.smith}}).

Additional information about the user rename feature:
https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Renamable+Users+in+JIRA+6.0
fields.summary: Issue history displays user key instead of username for reporter or assignee changes
Specify better the error when restoring a backup.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41214].
  {panel}

The REST API documentation should be improved with the possible parameters when running a reindex via REST.

We have two options when specifying the string parameter "type" however, in the documentation there is no mention of the options, which are "BACKGROUND" and "FOREGROUND".

It can make some friction with the customer who is trying to create some REST calls.

Documentation: https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/
fields.summary: Reindex REST endpoint missing parameters in the documentation
Alternative to Oracle Not Supporting Replication of Sequences

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41212].
  {panel}

h6. Problem
If you have issues on a JIRA instance that are assigned to an user that does not exist in the instance *and* the username has a dot (.) in it. This scenario can typically happen when you import a project from another instance.

h6. Steps to reproduce
# Either try to import a project from another instance that has at least one ticket assigned to an user with dot in the username and that user does not exist in the target instance. Alternatively you can try and update {{jiraissue}} table's assignee field to a sample username like 'some.thing' for an issue, then reindex the project.
# Check the project summary page and notice the issue to be listed under 'Unassigned'
# Clicking the unassigned link will redirect you to an issue result set that contains no issues (if there are no unassigned issues in the project)
fields.summary: Issues classified as unassigned if the assignee does not exist and has a dot in the username

fields.description:
One of our jira projects was named something like "MyProject " when it was created  Jira did not trim the trailing white space. It meant that searching for issues in this project with project="MyProject" did not return results.  Filters made with simple search worked because it was also adding the white-space to the filters when selecting the project name from the dropdown.  I Fixed the project name and then it proceeded to break everyone's saved filters because they were all saved with the trailing white-space.

When creating new projects, jira should trim trailing whitespace characters.

I am not certain what version we were on when the project was created, but we are currently on 6.2.5
fields.summary: Trailing white-space in project names is not trimmed
Prefill create issue template with information provided by REST or HTML/URL

fields.description: Incoming mails may end up with a creator and reporter set to different users. With creator being chosen randomly. There's a possible race condition between other services running and interfering with mail handlers.
fields.summary: Incoming mails have an incorrect creator set

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41206].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behaviour
Sub-Task does not auto transition when the parent issue transition in a workflow 

h3. Feature Request
Sub-Task should auto transition when the parent issue transition in a workflow
fields.summary: Auto transition Sub-Task when the parent issue transitioned in a workflow.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41204].
  {panel}

At the moment, on JIRA issue view page, for a status with long characters, status will show it half.

For example:
status *Waiting For Customer*, will be shown as *Waiting For Cust...*

It would be better to have the option to show it fully.
fields.summary: Having the option to show issue STATUS fully

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41203].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce : 
# Create a user(lets say 'test') and using the user, perform certain actions on any issue (like adding issue links, comments etc)
# Notice that the issue history tab shows changes made by this user 'test'.
# Now rename this user from administration console giving it a new username (say 'testabc').
# Now make some more changes to the issue using this renamed user.
# Now go to the history tab and notice that the old username 'test' is still being used. The new username 'testabc' is never used in the history tab.

This is expected behaviour looking at the way JIRA has been designed (checking for username field in table 'userhistoryitem' instead of user id). However for a user, this is a bug.
fields.summary: History tab shows old username after rename of username

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41201].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a issue filter with JQL "labels is not EMPTY"
2. Add a pie chart gadget which uses the above created filter.
3. Notice the statistics on the gadget. The Total issue count is less than the Other Issue count.
fields.summary: Pie Chart gadget is showing the wrong statistic for field which allows multiple values

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41199].
  {panel}

h3. Symptoms

After a migration, a full JIRA export is imported into a new instance, which means Confluence must be imported space by space.

Any existing links on JIRA tickets to Confluence pages (_Mentioned In_ links) are still to the old page ID so will not load.                                     

h3. Testing

*First Approach*

I imported customer JIRA and Connie data and my dev instance (https://adiallo.jira-dev.com) and was able to reproduce the issue. In the JIRA issue, I was seeing the  *Page Failed to load* under the *Issue Links* opposite the *mentioned in* option. That's the same way the customer is seeing it.

*Second Approach*

# I created a JIRA issue in another dev instance (https://stan.jira-dev.com/browse/BUR-5) and mentioned in and connie page (https://stan.jira-dev.com/wiki/display/ds/M%2Cz%3E%2Cxz%3Exz) and the display was fine from both side. 
# I exported JIRA and Connie from https://stan.jira-dev.com and imported it into: https://adiallo.jira-dev.com.
# After a successful import and reindex, booommm the same error appear in the JIRA Issue (https://adiallo.jira-dev.com/browse/BUR-5): *Page Failed to load* and from connie side it throws: *JIRA Issues Macro: Unable to locate JIRA server for this macro. It may be due to Application Link configuration*.
fields.summary: JIRA keeps dead links to Confluence pages after migration and space import
Add the ability to migrate comments from one user to another.
Affects Version disappear after moving an issue to a new project

fields.description:
If a user is deleted in the Active Directory, the {{User Deleted}} will be logged in the Audit Log every time the directory is synchronised.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

- Install a clean JIRA instance.
- Create a new user directory Microsoft Active Directory Connector.
- Create a new user in the Active Directory.
- Synchronise the user Directory.
- Give the user the proper permission in JIRA to be able to log in and create a few issues.
- Create and comment in a few issues.
- Delete the user in Active Directory.
- Perform another Directory Synchronisation.
- Check the Audit Log.
- There will be an entry in the log regarding the user Deletion.
- Perform another synch, the deletion will be logged every time you perform a synch.
!Screen Shot 2014-12-09 at 3.49.33 PM.png|thumbnail!
- The following appear in the logs during every synch:
{noformat}
atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-2 INFO ServiceRunner     [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] deleting [ x] users
atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-2 INFO ServiceRunner     [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] deleted [ x ] users in [ x ms ]
{noformat}
For a single user it should not be a problem, but in some cases many users may have been deleted in active directory, and then every time the directory is synched new dozens of entries of user deletion are added to the audit log, making it difficult to find useful information in the log.
fields.summary: Users Deleted in ActiveDirectory are logged in the AuditLog every Synchronisation.
Formatting of pasted in email message into comments behaves badly with wiki markup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41191].
  {panel}

Recently the design of the Smart query notification message has been updated in JIRA OnDemand. Whereas it used to be an unobtrusive message that would disappear shortly, it now appears as a yellow warning message in a location that covers several important buttons and even lingers on screen after following a link to an issue page from the search results.

There are a few things that could be implemented to make that notification less intrusive:

# Move the message to an unobtrusive location.
# Provide configuration options to disable the display of that notification.
# Make the notification disappear after a short time.
# At least make the notification disappear when the user is no longer on the search results page.
fields.summary: Improvements For The Smart Query Notification Banner

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41190].
  {panel}

It would be better to have the option for JIRA JQL Auto-complete to display the list in DESCENDING order

Example of use-case:
When the user has long list of "Version", it will display the old versions, while the user is intending to choose the recent version. 

Thus, it would be great to have the option of Descending order for JQL auto-complete
fields.summary: To have the option for JIRA JQL Auto-complete to display the list in DESCENDING order
Ability to have Customfield context for each IssueType of a Project
Spelling on Bulk Transition is incorrect

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41181].
  {panel}

Basically, JQL doesn't worry about the case for labels (mylabel == MYLABEL) but when creating an issue, the component does care about the sensitivity of the case (mylabel != MYLABEL) which is inconsistent behaviour. 

To reproduce:

1. Create a new issue
2. Give it label 'MYLABEL' all uppercase
3. Create the issue
4. Create another issue, and start typing 'MYL' to see that it suggests 'MYLABEL' as an existing label.
5. Delete this text and start typing 'myl' in lowercase and see that it wants to create a new label.
6. Don't create an issue and close the dialog.
7. Go to issue navigator
8. Type in JQL labels = 'mylabel'
9. See that the issue with label 'MYLABEL' appears
fields.summary: Labels are not case sensitive in JQL but are case sensitive when creating a label
Gadgets do not reflect opsbar-sequence property
Manage Issue Type Screen alphabetical sorting.
I should be able to monitor incoming mails jobs
Mail Handler to only check the Subject header for creation and commenting on issues

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*:
# Create a New Project.
# Create a New Issue.
# On the Due date specify date like 
{code}10/VI/15{code}
# Press ENTER.

*Expected Result*:
The Due Date will be set to 10 June 2015

*Actual Results*:
There will be an error appear saying to input in the correct format like 
{code} duedate: You did not enter a valid date. Please enter the date in the format "d/MMM/yy", eg. "8/Dec/14" {code}

*Notes*:
* There is a possibility that java SimpleDateFormat could not handle such input as it is expected it as a String Type rather than Numerals.
* This will affect the countries that is using Roman Numerals on their date.	
* Using the Czech Translation Pack for JIRA 6.2.5 will able to make it work
* After investigation, this is issue is a *JDK 1.8-specific problem*. Using JDK 1.7 would be able to use Roman Numerals in the date picker.

*Workaround*:
Change the instance JAVA to use JDK 1.7. If it is using built-in JAVA (Installer Bundled), follow the documetation below:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/How+to+Use+System+JRE+Instead+of+Embedded+JRE
fields.summary: Support for Roman Numerals in JIRA's Date Format Configuration

fields.description:
Hi Experts

I have an issue with creating a default description based on Issue Type and Based on what Option is selected from the Custom Field.

Not sure whether I am working on this correctly but I will explain what I expecting first.

For Issue Type: Service Request I have a Custom Field Called Request Type (3 Options are available) For each of these 3 options when one is selected I would like a different Description to display. Currently it doesn't actually change the description based on Custom Field

This is my code what I have placed in /opt/jira/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/templates/jira/issue/field/description_edit.vm

{noformat}
## =======================================
## START CUSTOMIZATION


## SET INCIDENT
#if (($issue.key == $null) && ($issue.getIssueTypeObject().getName() == "Incident"))
    #set ($description = 'h6. Steps to Reproduce
        # Navigate to ...
        # Click on ...
        \
        h6. Expected Results
        \
        h6. Actual Results
        \
        h6. Other Information (Browser, Browser Version, Environment)')
    #set ($description = $description.replace('\',''))


## SET SERVICE REQUEST 'NONE'
#elseif ((($issue.key == $null) && ($issue.getIssueTypeObject().getName() == "Service Request"))
        ($ComponentAccessor.getCustomFieldManager().getCustomFieldObjectByValue("customfield_11504")));
        #if ($getcustomfieldObjectByValue("customfield_11504").getOptionbyName == "Enhancement")
        #set ($description = 'Please select a Request Type')
        #set ($description = $description.replace('\',''))


## SET SERVICE REQUEST 'DEPLOYMENT'
    #elseif ($OptionManager.getOption == "Deployment")
        #set ($description = 'h6. Name of System -
                \
                h6. Environment -
                \
                h6. Expected Delivery Date / Time -')
        #set ($description = $description.replace('\',''))

## SET SERVICE REQUEST 'NEW ACCOUNT'
        #else
                #if ($OptionManager.getOption == "New Account")
                #set ($description = 'h6. Are you requesting for a new account to be set up?
                /
                h6. Name of System -
                /
                h6. Name of New User -
                /
                h6. Contact Information (Email Address, Contact Number) -')
        #set ($description = $description.replace('\',''))
                #end
        #end


## SET CHANGE REQUEST
#else
        #if (($issue.key == $null) && ($issue.getIssueTypeObject().getName() == "Change Request"))
                #set ($description = 'h6. Change Logs
                \
                h6. Deployment Script
                \
                h6. Deployment Verification
                \
                h6. Roll Back Plan')
                #set ($description = $description.replace('\',''))
        #end
#end


## END CUSTOMIZATION
## =======================================
{noformat}

For incident and Change request these actually do change the description and these will not need to be changed or modified in anyway

Any help would be appreciated

Regards

Brian
fields.summary: Issue setting a default description based on Custom Field (Select List)

fields.description:
*Symptom*
Autoupdate of plugins fail

*Diagnosis*
The following stack trace is observed in logs:
{noformat}
2014-09-24 11:16:09,401 UpmPacClient:thread-10 WARN jiraadmin 738x445x3 ab65c3 192.168.0.4 /rest/plugins/1.0/installed-marketplace [impl.client.cache.CachingHttpClient] Unable to store entries in cache
java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(Unknown Source)
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(Unknown Source)
	at sun.security.ssl.InputRecord.readFully(Unknown Source)
	at sun.security.ssl.InputRecord.readV3Record(Unknown Source)
	at sun.security.ssl.InputRecord.read(Unknown Source)
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.readRecord(Unknown Source)
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.readDataRecord(Unknown Source)
	at sun.security.ssl.AppInputStream.read(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.http.impl.io.AbstractSessionInputBuffer.read(AbstractSessionInputBuffer.java:198)
	at org.apache.http.impl.io.ContentLengthInputStream.read(ContentLengthInputStream.java:178)
	at org.apache.http.conn.EofSensorInputStream.read(EofSensorInputStream.java:137)
	at org.apache.http.conn.EofSensorInputStream.read(EofSensorInputStream.java:150)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.cache.HeapResourceFactory.generate(HeapResourceFactory.java:54)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.cache.SizeLimitedResponseReader.doConsume(SizeLimitedResponseReader.java:106)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.cache.SizeLimitedResponseReader.readResponse(SizeLimitedResponseReader.java:77)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.cache.BasicHttpCache.cacheAndReturnResponse(BasicHttpCache.java:294)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.cache.BasicHttpCache.cacheAndReturnResponse(BasicHttpCache.java:279)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.cache.CachingHttpClient.handleBackendResponse(CachingHttpClient.java:941)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.cache.CachingHttpClient.callBackend(CachingHttpClient.java:748)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.cache.CachingHttpClient.handleCacheMiss(CachingHttpClient.java:520)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.cache.CachingHttpClient.execute(CachingHttpClient.java:451)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.cache.CachingHttpClient.execute(CachingHttpClient.java:360)
	at com.atlassian.marketplace.client.impl.CommonsHttpHelper.executeMethod(CommonsHttpHelper.java:179)
	at com.atlassian.marketplace.client.impl.CommonsHttpHelper.get(CommonsHttpHelper.java:93)

	at com.atlassian.marketplace.client.impl.PluginsImpl.get(PluginsImpl.java:155)
	at com.atlassian.upm.pac.PacClientImpl.getAvailableUpdate(PacClientImpl.java:530)
	at com.atlassian.upm.pac.PacClientImpl.access$1000(PacClientImpl.java:110)
	at com.atlassian.upm.pac.PacClientImpl$16$1.call(PacClientImpl.java:1074)
	at com.atlassian.upm.pac.PacClientImpl$16$1.call(PacClientImpl.java:1070)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(Unknown Source)

{noformat}

This is due to the external bug [HTTPCLIENT-1280|https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HTTPCLIENT-1280] on {{org.apache.httpcomponents.httpclient-4.2.5}}. The bug is fixed in version 4.3 so JIRA should bundle the fix.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41169].
  {panel}

Scenario:

When creating an issue the administrator may want to give the user the option to assign the issue to someone specific, so the 'assignee' field is added to the issue create screen. The default value of the assignee field is the current user, so this means that any issue created will be assigned to the current user by default. It should be possible to configure a default value for the assignee field so that the freedom to choose assignee is available, but if the user doesn't choose an assignee then it will default to automatic.

Documentation states:
{quote}*Selecting a Default Assignee*
You can optionally set a Default Assignee for a component. This will override the project's default assignee, for issues in that component. If an issue has multiple components, and the default assignees of components clash, the assignee will be set to the default assignee of the component that is first alphabetically.
||Default Assignee Option||Description||Notes|
|Unassigned|The assignee of the issue will not be set on the creation of this issue.|This option will only be available if "Allow unassigned issues" is enabled in the General Configuration.| {quote}

Which is not happening.

*Workaround:*
# Set the assignee field manually.
OR
# Set a post-function on your workflow that overrides the assignee value the user sets. - the downside of this being that the user will be confused by the fact that they chose an assignee but it's ignored.
OR
# Remove the assignee field from the create issue screen so that it defaults to unassigned. - the downside being that you'll need to set up a new screen just for creating issues.
fields.summary: Set assignee field default value
Hypertext and Javascript needs replacement before deprecation
support for event notification when ranks of the issues changes
Allow Multiple Users Edit Rights to a Dashboard
Can't edit multi-line summary
Have a list of gadgets in JIRA that tries to connect to the internet

fields.description:
h4. Summary
It takes a lot of time to export issues (for example to Excel, or XML), most of the time is spent rendering custom fields.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Search for set list of issues using a JQL Query
# Click the *Export > XML* or *Excel (All fields)* button

h4. Expected Results
It's expected to have the result returned faster for a small amount of issues

h4. Actual Results
The time it took to generate the result was relatively long
fields.summary: Improve performance of rendering custom fields during Export to Excel or XML

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41157].
  {panel}

To work around the lack of bulk linking support (JRA-2428), I prepared a comma-separated list of issue keys, opened the "link issue" dialog and pasted the list into the issue key field. I would have expected either unmodified plain text, e.g.
bq. ABC-17,ABC-39,DEF-20,XYZ-1
or properly separated individual issue keys like
bq. \[ABC-17 ^x^\] \[ABC-39 ^x^\] \[DEF-20 ^x^\] \[XYZ-1 ^x^\]

However, JIRA turned the entire input into one issue key, something like this:
bq. \[ABC-17,ABC-39,DEF-20,XYZ-1 ^x^\]

When submitting the form, it then rejected this input, telling me an issue with the key {{ABC-17,ABC-39,DEF-20,XYZ-1}} did not exist.

AFAIK, commas are not a valid character in issue keys, so the behavior JIRA shows does not make any sense. It should be changed to produce one of the two expected results given above.

The same problem occurs when using spaces instead of commas.
fields.summary: Issue link dialog should allow a comma-separated list of issues

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Doing multiple Bulk Action operations is resource intensive and can contribute to overall performance problem, such as increased in page load times due to JIRA consuming CPU resources.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# In *Issue Navigator*, search a set list of issue using a JQL Query
# Click on *Tools > Bulk Change | all (X) issue(s)* button

h4. Expected Results
It's expected to have the result returned faster

h4. Actual Results
The time it took to generate the result was relatively long due to evaluating permission for each issues on the bulk change action.
fields.summary: Bulk Action page is very slow for large amount of issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41155].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there are times where an invalid XML character that is inserted into the instance can cause problems when trying to import the XML export of that instance. This can lead to frustrations (as they would either have to find it manually, or run the XML through the [XML cleaner|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Removing+invalid+characters+from+XML+backups].

h3. Suggested Solution
It would more effective (and efficient) if the import can automatically filter out these invalid characters. A better (but possibly tougher alternative) would be to disallow those characters from being inserted into the instance in the first place.
fields.summary: Have some way to filter out invalid XML characters when importing (or better yet, avoid them from being entered in the first place)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41154].
  {panel}

In Recent Update To OnDemand
a *Won't Do* Resolution has been added to OnDemand JIRA instances.
(See Screenshot)

Can be seen at G+G *resolutions* screen:
https://<INSTANCE_NAME>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewResolutions.jspa

No Notation of function or related transitions.  Also No mention in release documentation Is noted.
fields.summary: Won't Do Resolution Added
Issue Search should display more clearly whether you are logged in or not

fields.description: Similar to JRA-38151, it would be nice to not blow away user's forms if they hit escape on a transition window.
fields.summary: No dirty warning when hitting escape on transition screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41150].
  {panel}

The documentation page  [Cloning an Issue | https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Cloning+an+Issue] mentions that custom fields are cloned but has nothing regarding how cloning affects Agile Sprints. 

The number of votes/comments on [GHS-6541 | https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-6541] proves that this is something customers need to be aware of.
* There are also comments on the article itself regarding the sprint field and it being cloned

This suggestion is to either add info about JIRA Agile to that Clone Issue page or add a link to a page containing the caveats that a customer should be aware of. 
* An example would be [this KB article |  https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/Clear+Sprint+information+when+cloning+JIRA+issue]
fields.summary: Update Clone Issue Docs to include or link to JIRA Agile caveats
Can't add group to Global Permissions
Bugzilla Import definitions
Add Watchers through View Issue Screen Fails when accessing issues sequentially without Browse Users permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41143].
  {panel}

In some circumstances an LDAP server can hang during a sync, which will cause JIRA to keep the sync action open indefinitely. It would be nice if the directory configuration page could show the following information:

- Current syncs running from the scheduler. 
- The amount of time the an active sync has been running
- A stop/reset button that will roll back to the previous state in case manual intervention is required
fields.summary: Add Ability to Reset/Stop an LDAP sync via GUI
